AddToDateTime(Timeframe, int, DateTime)

Adds to specified dateTime a specified count of timeframe units. For example, 10 seconds Is not applicable to Tick

EstimateBarCount(Timeframe, int, DateTime, DateTime, TradingHours)

Calculates an approximate bar count between 2 dates

public static int EstimateBarCount(this Timeframe timeframe, int period, DateTime begin, DateTime end, TradingHours tradingHours)

Parameters

timeframe Timeframe
period int

A period to aggregate bars

begin DateTime
end DateTime
tradingHours TradingHours

Returns

int

Remarks

Do not use this method for Tick because it is not a time-based timeframe If you have an instrument, you can obtain its trading hours via TradingHours

EstimateStartTime(Timeframe, int, DateTime, int, TradingHours)

Parameters

A period to aggregate bars

Remarks

Do not use this method for Tick because it is not a time-based timeframe If you have an instrument, you can obtain its trading hours via TradingHours

FormatTime(Timeframe, DateTime, CultureInfo?)

Uses ToString(string) with different format settings according to specified timeframe For example, for tick or second it is full time format, including seconds, for minute - without seconds, for day - without time at all etc

public static string FormatTime(this Timeframe me, DateTime dt, CultureInfo? cultureInfo = null)

Parameters

me Timeframe
dt DateTime
cultureInfo CultureInfo

Returns

string

GetDescription(Timeframe, int)

Extended version of FinSysPlatform.NetExtension.Extensions.EnumExtensions which supports period. The result looks like 1 minute, 2 Hours, 3 Weeks, etc.

public static string GetDescription(this Timeframe me, int period)

Parameters

me Timeframe
period int

Returns

string

GetNextTime(Timeframe, DateTime)

Get next aligned time following after dt

public static DateTime GetNextTime(this Timeframe me, DateTime dt)

Parameters

me Timeframe
dt DateTime

Returns

DateTime

Examples

Let current time be 22:34:35. Timeframe - Hour Aligned value will be 22:00:00, next aligned time will be 23:00:00

GetPriorTime(Timeframe, DateTime)

Get prior aligned time following after dt

public static DateTime GetPriorTime(this Timeframe me, DateTime dt)

Parameters

me Timeframe
dt DateTime

Returns

DateTime

Examples

Let current time be 22:34:35. Timeframe - Hour Aligned value will be 22:00:00, prior aligned time will be 21:00:00

GetShortName(Timeframe, int)

Extended version of GetShortName(Enum) which supports period. The result looks like M1, H4, D2, etc.

public static string GetShortName(this Timeframe me, int period)

me Timeframe

Enum element

period int

Returns

Short name declared via attribute FinSysPlatform.NetExtension.Attributes.ShortNameAttribute

IsTimeAligned(Timeframe, DateTime)

Returns true if specified time dt is aligned to me, and false otherwise

public static bool IsTimeAligned(this Timeframe me, DateTime dt)

ToSeconds(Timeframe, int)

Converts specified me with specified period into seconds

public static long ToSeconds(this Timeframe me, int period)

Parameters

me Timeframe
period int

Returns

long

Remarks

Pay attention, that this method does not work with Tick because it is not time-based timeframe For ticks this method always returns 0
